text:
7.2. Univariate MLP Models 56
7.2.2 MLP Model
A simple MLP model has a single hidden layer of nodes, and an output layer used to make a
prediction. We can deﬁne an MLP for univariate time series forecasting as follows.
# define model
model = Sequential()
model.add(Dense(100, activation=' relu' , input_dim=n_steps))
model.add(Dense(1))
model.compile(optimizer=' adam' , loss=' mse' )
Listing 7.6: Example of deﬁning an MLP model.
